00041 #include "list.h"

00043 CSndLossList::CSndLossList(const int& size):
00044 m_piData1(NULL),
00045 m_piData2(NULL),
00046 m_piNext(NULL),
00047 m_iHead(-1),
00048 m_iLength(0),
00049 m_iSize(size),
00050 m_iLastInsertPos(-1),
00051 m_ListLock()
00052 {
00053    m_piData1 = new int32_t [m_iSize];
00054    m_piData2 = new int32_t [m_iSize];
00055    m_piNext = new int [m_iSize];
00056 
00057    // -1 means there is no data in the node
00058    for (int i = 0; i < size; ++ i)
00059    {
00060       m_piData1[i] = -1;
00061       m_piData2[i] = -1;
00062    }
00063 
00064    // sender list needs mutex protection
00065    #ifndef WIN32
00066       pthread_mutex_init(&m_ListLock, 0);
00067    #else
00068       m_ListLock = CreateMutex(NULL, false, NULL);
00069    #endif
00070 }
00071 
00072 CSndLossList::~CSndLossList()
00073 {
00074    delete [] m_piData1;
00075    delete [] m_piData2;
00076    delete [] m_piNext;
00077 
00078    #ifndef WIN32
00079       pthread_mutex_destroy(&m_ListLock);
00080    #else
00081       CloseHandle(m_ListLock);
00082    #endif
00083 }
00084 
00085 int CSndLossList::insert(const int32_t& seqno1, const int32_t& seqno2)
00086 {
00087    CGuard listguard(m_ListLock);
00088 
00089    if (0 == m_iLength)
00090    {
00091       // insert data into an empty list
00092 
00093       m_iHead = 0;
00094       m_piData1[m_iHead] = seqno1;
00095       if (seqno2 != seqno1)
00096          m_piData2[m_iHead] = seqno2;
00097 
00098       m_piNext[m_iHead] = -1;
00099       m_iLastInsertPos = m_iHead;
00100 
00101       m_iLength += CSeqNo::seqlen(seqno1, seqno2);
00102 
00103       return m_iLength;
00104    }
00105 
00106    // otherwise find the position where the data can be inserted
00107    int origlen = m_iLength;
00108    int offset = CSeqNo::seqoff(m_piData1[m_iHead], seqno1);
00109    int loc = (m_iHead + offset + m_iSize) % m_iSize;
00110 
00111    if (offset < 0)
00112    {
00113       // Insert data prior to the head pointer
00114 
00115       m_piData1[loc] = seqno1;
00116       if (seqno2 != seqno1)
00117          m_piData2[loc] = seqno2;
00118 
00119       // new node becomes head
00120       m_piNext[loc] = m_iHead;
00121       m_iHead = loc;
00122       m_iLastInsertPos = loc;
00123 
00124       m_iLength += CSeqNo::seqlen(seqno1, seqno2);
00125    }
00126    else if (offset > 0)
00127    {
00128       if (seqno1 == m_piData1[loc])
00129       {
00130          m_iLastInsertPos = loc;
00131 
00132          // first seqno is equivlent, compare the second
00133          if (-1 == m_piData2[loc])
00134          {
00135             if (seqno2 != seqno1)
00136             {
00137                m_iLength += CSeqNo::seqlen(seqno1, seqno2) - 1;
00138                m_piData2[loc] = seqno2;
00139             }
00140          }
00141          else if (CSeqNo::seqcmp(seqno2, m_piData2[loc]) > 0)
00142          {
00143             // new seq pair is longer than old pair, e.g., insert [3, 7] to [3, 5], becomes [3, 7]
00144             m_iLength += CSeqNo::seqlen(m_piData2[loc], seqno2) - 1;
00145             m_piData2[loc] = seqno2;
00146          }
00147          else
00148             // Do nothing if it is already there
00149             return 0;
00150       }
00151       else
00152       {
00153          // searching the prior node
00154          int i;
00155          if ((-1 != m_iLastInsertPos) && (CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData1[m_iLastInsertPos], seqno1) < 0))
00156             i = m_iLastInsertPos;
00157          else
00158             i = m_iHead;
00159 
00160          while ((-1 != m_piNext[i]) && (CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData1[m_piNext[i]], seqno1) < 0))
00161             i = m_piNext[i];
00162 
00163          if ((-1 == m_piData2[i]) || (CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData2[i], seqno1) < 0))
00164          {
00165             m_iLastInsertPos = loc;
00166 
00167             // no overlap, create new node
00168             m_piData1[loc] = seqno1;
00169             if (seqno2 != seqno1)
00170                m_piData2[loc] = seqno2;
00171 
00172             m_piNext[loc] = m_piNext[i];
00173             m_piNext[i] = loc;
00174 
00175             m_iLength += CSeqNo::seqlen(seqno1, seqno2);
00176          }
00177          else
00178          {
00179             m_iLastInsertPos = i;
00180 
00181             // overlap, coalesce with prior node, insert(3, 7) to [2, 5], ... becomes [2, 7]
00182             if (CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData2[i], seqno2) < 0)
00183             {
00184                m_iLength += CSeqNo::seqlen(m_piData2[i], seqno2) - 1;
00185                m_piData2[i] = seqno2;
00186 
00187                loc = i;
00188             }
00189             else
00190                return 0;
00191          }
00192       }
00193    }
00194    else
00195    {
00196       m_iLastInsertPos = m_iHead;
00197 
00198       // insert to head node
00199       if (seqno2 != seqno1)
00200       {
00201          if (-1 == m_piData2[loc])
00202          {
00203             m_iLength += CSeqNo::seqlen(seqno1, seqno2) - 1;
00204             m_piData2[loc] = seqno2;
00205          }
00206          else if (CSeqNo::seqcmp(seqno2, m_piData2[loc]) > 0)
00207          {
00208             m_iLength += CSeqNo::seqlen(m_piData2[loc], seqno2) - 1;
00209             m_piData2[loc] = seqno2;
00210          }
00211          else 
00212             return 0;
00213       }
00214       else
00215          return 0;
00216    }
00217 
00218    // coalesce with next node. E.g., [3, 7], ..., [6, 9] becomes [3, 9] 
00219    while ((-1 != m_piNext[loc]) && (-1 != m_piData2[loc]))
00220    {
00221       int i = m_piNext[loc];
00222 
00223       if (CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData1[i], CSeqNo::incseq(m_piData2[loc])) <= 0)
00224       {
00225          // coalesce if there is overlap
00226          if (-1 != m_piData2[i])
00227          {
00228             if (CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData2[i], m_piData2[loc]) > 0)
00229             {
00230                if (CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData2[loc], m_piData1[i]) >= 0)
00231                   m_iLength -= CSeqNo::seqlen(m_piData1[i], m_piData2[loc]);
00232 
00233                m_piData2[loc] = m_piData2[i];
00234             }
00235             else
00236                m_iLength -= CSeqNo::seqlen(m_piData1[i], m_piData2[i]);
00237          }
00238          else
00239          {
00240             if (m_piData1[i] == CSeqNo::incseq(m_piData2[loc]))
00241                m_piData2[loc] = m_piData1[i];
00242             else
00243                m_iLength --;
00244          }
00245 
00246          m_piData1[i] = -1;
00247          m_piData2[i] = -1;
00248          m_piNext[loc] = m_piNext[i];
00249       }
00250       else
00251          break;
00252    }
00253 
00254    return m_iLength - origlen;
00255 }
00256 
00257 void CSndLossList::remove(const int32_t& seqno)
00258 {
00259    CGuard listguard(m_ListLock);
00260 
00261    if (0 == m_iLength)
00262       return;
00263 
00264    // Remove all from the head pointer to a node with a larger seq. no. or the list is empty
00265    int offset = CSeqNo::seqoff(m_piData1[m_iHead], seqno);
00266    int loc = (m_iHead + offset + m_iSize) % m_iSize;
00267 
00268    if (0 == offset)
00269    {
00270       // It is the head. Remove the head and point to the next node
00271       loc = (loc + 1) % m_iSize;
00272 
00273       if (-1 == m_piData2[m_iHead])
00274          loc = m_piNext[m_iHead];
00275       else
00276       {
00277          m_piData1[loc] = CSeqNo::incseq(seqno);
00278          if (CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData2[m_iHead], CSeqNo::incseq(seqno)) > 0)
00279             m_piData2[loc] = m_piData2[m_iHead];
00280 
00281          m_piData2[m_iHead] = -1;
00282 
00283          m_piNext[loc] = m_piNext[m_iHead];
00284       }
00285 
00286       m_piData1[m_iHead] = -1;
00287 
00288       if (m_iLastInsertPos == m_iHead)
00289          m_iLastInsertPos = -1;
00290 
00291       m_iHead = loc;
00292 
00293       m_iLength --;
00294    }
00295    else if (offset > 0)
00296    {
00297       int h = m_iHead;
00298 
00299       if (seqno == m_piData1[loc])
00300       {
00301          // target node is not empty, remove part/all of the seqno in the node.
00302          int temp = loc;
00303          loc = (loc + 1) % m_iSize;
00304 
00305          if (-1 == m_piData2[temp])
00306             m_iHead = m_piNext[temp];
00307          else
00308          {
00309             // remove part, e.g., [3, 7] becomes [], [4, 7] after remove(3)
00310             m_piData1[loc] = CSeqNo::incseq(seqno);
00311             if (CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData2[temp], m_piData1[loc]) > 0)
00312                m_piData2[loc] = m_piData2[temp];
00313             m_iHead = loc;
00314             m_piNext[loc] = m_piNext[temp];
00315             m_piNext[temp] = loc;
00316             m_piData2[temp] = -1;
00317          }
00318       }
00319       else
00320       {
00321          // target node is empty, check prior node
00322          int i = m_iHead;
00323          while ((-1 != m_piNext[i]) && (CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData1[m_piNext[i]], seqno) < 0))
00324             i = m_piNext[i];
00325 
00326          loc = (loc + 1) % m_iSize;
00327 
00328          if (-1 == m_piData2[i])
00329             m_iHead = m_piNext[i];
00330          else if (CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData2[i], seqno) > 0)
00331          {
00332             // remove part/all seqno in the prior node
00333             m_piData1[loc] = CSeqNo::incseq(seqno);
00334             if (CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData2[i], m_piData1[loc]) > 0)
00335                m_piData2[loc] = m_piData2[i];
00336 
00337             m_piData2[i] = seqno;
00338 
00339             m_piNext[loc] = m_piNext[i];
00340             m_piNext[i] = loc;
00341 
00342             m_iHead = loc;
00343          }
00344          else
00345             m_iHead = m_piNext[i];
00346       }
00347 
00348       // Remove all nodes prior to the new head
00349       while (h != m_iHead)
00350       {
00351          if (m_piData2[h] != -1)
00352          {
00353             m_iLength -= CSeqNo::seqlen(m_piData1[h], m_piData2[h]);
00354             m_piData2[h] = -1;
00355          }
00356          else
00357             m_iLength --;
00358 
00359          m_piData1[h] = -1;
00360 
00361          if (m_iLastInsertPos == h)
00362             m_iLastInsertPos = -1;
00363 
00364          h = m_piNext[h];
00365       }
00366    }
00367 }
00368 
00369 int CSndLossList::getLossLength()
00370 {
00371    CGuard listguard(m_ListLock);
00372 
00373    return m_iLength;
00374 }
00375 
00376 int32_t CSndLossList::getLostSeq()
00377 {
00378    if (0 == m_iLength)
00379      return -1;
00380 
00381    CGuard listguard(m_ListLock);
00382 
00383    if (0 == m_iLength)
00384      return -1;
00385 
00386    if (m_iLastInsertPos == m_iHead)
00387       m_iLastInsertPos = -1;
00388 
00389    // return the first loss seq. no.
00390    int32_t seqno = m_piData1[m_iHead];
00391 
00392    // head moves to the next node
00393    if (-1 == m_piData2[m_iHead])
00394    {
00395       //[3, -1] becomes [], and head moves to next node in the list
00396       m_piData1[m_iHead] = -1;
00397       m_iHead = m_piNext[m_iHead];
00398    }
00399    else
00400    {
00401       // shift to next node, e.g., [3, 7] becomes [], [4, 7]
00402       int loc = (m_iHead + 1) % m_iSize;
00403 
00404       m_piData1[loc] = CSeqNo::incseq(seqno);
00405       if (CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData2[m_iHead], m_piData1[loc]) > 0)
00406          m_piData2[loc] = m_piData2[m_iHead];
00407 
00408       m_piData1[m_iHead] = -1;
00409       m_piData2[m_iHead] = -1;
00410 
00411       m_piNext[loc] = m_piNext[m_iHead];
00412       m_iHead = loc;
00413    }
00414 
00415    m_iLength --;
00416 
00417    return seqno;
00418 }
00419 
00421 
00422 CRcvLossList::CRcvLossList(const int& size):
00423 m_piData1(NULL),
00424 m_piData2(NULL),
00425 m_piNext(NULL),
00426 m_piPrior(NULL),
00427 m_iHead(-1),
00428 m_iTail(-1),
00429 m_iLength(0),
00430 m_iSize(size),
00431 m_TimeStamp()
00432 {
00433    m_piData1 = new int32_t [m_iSize];
00434    m_piData2 = new int32_t [m_iSize];
00435    m_piNext = new int [m_iSize];
00436    m_piPrior = new int [m_iSize];
00437 
00438    // -1 means there is no data in the node
00439    for (int i = 0; i < size; ++ i)
00440    {
00441       m_piData1[i] = -1;
00442       m_piData2[i] = -1;
00443    }
00444 
00445    m_TimeStamp = CTimer::getTime();
00446 }
00447 
00448 CRcvLossList::~CRcvLossList()
00449 {
00450    delete [] m_piData1;
00451    delete [] m_piData2;
00452    delete [] m_piNext;
00453    delete [] m_piPrior;
00454 }
00455 
00456 void CRcvLossList::insert(const int32_t& seqno1, const int32_t& seqno2)
00457 {
00458    m_TimeStamp = CTimer::getTime();
00459 
00460    // Data to be inserted must be larger than all those in the list
00461    // guaranteed by the UDT receiver
00462 
00463    if (0 == m_iLength)
00464    {
00465       // insert data into an empty list
00466       m_iHead = 0;
00467       m_iTail = 0;
00468       m_piData1[m_iHead] = seqno1;
00469       if (seqno2 != seqno1)
00470          m_piData2[m_iHead] = seqno2;
00471 
00472       m_piNext[m_iHead] = -1;
00473       m_piPrior[m_iHead] = -1;
00474       m_iLength += CSeqNo::seqlen(seqno1, seqno2);
00475 
00476       return;
00477    }
00478 
00479    // otherwise searching for the position where the node should be
00480    int offset = CSeqNo::seqoff(m_piData1[m_iHead], seqno1);
00481    int loc = (m_iHead + offset) % m_iSize;
00482 
00483    if ((-1 != m_piData2[m_iTail]) && (CSeqNo::incseq(m_piData2[m_iTail]) == seqno1))
00484    {
00485       // coalesce with prior node, e.g., [2, 5], [6, 7] becomes [2, 7]
00486       loc = m_iTail;
00487       m_piData2[loc] = seqno2;
00488    }
00489    else
00490    {
00491       // create new node
00492       m_piData1[loc] = seqno1;
00493 
00494       if (seqno2 != seqno1)
00495          m_piData2[loc] = seqno2;
00496 
00497       m_piNext[m_iTail] = loc;
00498       m_piPrior[loc] = m_iTail;
00499       m_piNext[loc] = -1;
00500       m_iTail = loc;
00501    }
00502 
00503    m_iLength += CSeqNo::seqlen(seqno1, seqno2);
00504 }
00505 
00506 bool CRcvLossList::remove(const int32_t& seqno)
00507 {
00508    m_TimeStamp = CTimer::getTime();
00509 
00510    if (0 == m_iLength)
00511       return false; 
00512 
00513    // locate the position of "seqno" in the list
00514    int offset = CSeqNo::seqoff(m_piData1[m_iHead], seqno);
00515    if (offset < 0)
00516       return false;
00517 
00518    int loc = (m_iHead + offset) % m_iSize;
00519 
00520    if (seqno == m_piData1[loc])
00521    {
00522       // This is a seq. no. that starts the loss sequence
00523 
00524       if (-1 == m_piData2[loc])
00525       {
00526          // there is only 1 loss in the sequence, delete it from the node
00527          if (m_iHead == loc)
00528          {
00529             m_iHead = m_piNext[m_iHead];
00530             if (-1 != m_iHead)
00531                m_piPrior[m_iHead] = -1;
00532          }
00533          else
00534          {
00535             m_piNext[m_piPrior[loc]] = m_piNext[loc];
00536             if (-1 != m_piNext[loc])
00537                m_piPrior[m_piNext[loc]] = m_piPrior[loc];
00538             else
00539                m_iTail = m_piPrior[loc];
00540          }
00541 
00542          m_piData1[loc] = -1;
00543       }
00544       else
00545       {
00546          // there are more than 1 loss in the sequence
00547          // move the node to the next and update the starter as the next loss inSeqNo(seqno)
00548 
00549          // find next node
00550          int i = (loc + 1) % m_iSize;
00551 
00552          // remove the "seqno" and change the starter as next seq. no.
00553          m_piData1[i] = CSeqNo::incseq(m_piData1[loc]);
00554 
00555          // process the sequence end
00556          if (CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData2[loc], CSeqNo::incseq(m_piData1[loc])) > 0)
00557             m_piData2[i] = m_piData2[loc];
00558 
00559          // remove the current node
00560          m_piData1[loc] = -1;
00561          m_piData2[loc] = -1;
00562  
00563          // update list pointer
00564          m_piNext[i] = m_piNext[loc];
00565          m_piPrior[i] = m_piPrior[loc];
00566 
00567          if (m_iHead == loc)
00568             m_iHead = i;
00569          else
00570             m_piNext[m_piPrior[i]] = i;
00571 
00572          if (m_iTail == loc)
00573             m_iTail = i;
00574          else
00575             m_piPrior[m_piNext[i]] = i;
00576       }
00577 
00578       m_iLength --;
00579 
00580       return true;
00581    }
00582 
00583    // There is no loss sequence in the current position
00584    // the "seqno" may be contained in a previous node
00585 
00586    // searching previous node
00587    int i = (loc - 1 + m_iSize) % m_iSize;
00588    while (-1 == m_piData1[i])
00589       i = (i - 1 + m_iSize) % m_iSize;
00590 
00591    // not contained in this node, return
00592    if ((-1 == m_piData2[i]) || (CSeqNo::seqcmp(seqno, m_piData2[i]) > 0))
00593        return false;
00594 
00595    if (seqno == m_piData2[i])
00596    {
00597       // it is the sequence end
00598 
00599       if (seqno == CSeqNo::incseq(m_piData1[i]))
00600          m_piData2[i] = -1;
00601       else
00602          m_piData2[i] = CSeqNo::decseq(seqno);
00603    }
00604    else
00605    {
00606       // split the sequence
00607 
00608       // construct the second sequence from CSeqNo::incseq(seqno) to the original sequence end
00609       // located at "loc + 1"
00610       loc = (loc + 1) % m_iSize;
00611 
00612       m_piData1[loc] = CSeqNo::incseq(seqno);
00613       if (CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData2[i], m_piData1[loc]) > 0)      
00614          m_piData2[loc] = m_piData2[i];
00615 
00616       // the first (original) sequence is between the original sequence start to CSeqNo::decseq(seqno)
00617       if (seqno == CSeqNo::incseq(m_piData1[i]))
00618          m_piData2[i] = -1;
00619       else
00620          m_piData2[i] = CSeqNo::decseq(seqno);
00621 
00622       // update the list pointer
00623       m_piNext[loc] = m_piNext[i];
00624       m_piNext[i] = loc;
00625       m_piPrior[loc] = i;
00626 
00627       if (m_iTail == i)
00628          m_iTail = loc;
00629       else
00630          m_piPrior[m_piNext[loc]] = loc;
00631    }
00632 
00633    m_iLength --;
00634 
00635    return true;
00636 }
00637 
00638 bool CRcvLossList::remove(const int32_t& seqno1, const int32_t& seqno2)
00639 {
00640    if (seqno1 <= seqno2)
00641    {
00642       for (int32_t i = seqno1; i <= seqno2; ++ i)
00643          remove(i);
00644    }
00645    else
00646    {
00647       for (int32_t j = seqno1; j < CSeqNo::m_iMaxSeqNo; ++ j)
00648          remove(j);
00649       for (int32_t k = 0; k <= seqno2; ++ k)
00650          remove(k);
00651    }
00652 
00653    return true;
00654 }
00655 
00656 bool CRcvLossList::find(const int32_t& seqno1, const int32_t& seqno2) const
00657 {
00658    if (0 == m_iLength)
00659       return false;
00660 
00661    int p = m_iHead;
00662 
00663    while (-1 != p)
00664    {
00665       if ((CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData1[p], seqno1) == 0) ||
00666           ((CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData1[p], seqno1) > 0) && (CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData1[p], seqno2) <= 0)) ||
00667           ((CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData1[p], seqno1) < 0) && (m_piData2[p] != -1) && CSeqNo::seqcmp(m_piData2[p], seqno1) >= 0))
00668           return true;
00669 
00670       p = m_piNext[p];
00671    }
00672 
00673    return false;
00674 }
00675 
00676 int CRcvLossList::getLossLength() const
00677 {
00678    return m_iLength;
00679 }
00680 
00681 int CRcvLossList::getFirstLostSeq() const
00682 {
00683    if (0 == m_iLength)
00684       return -1;
00685 
00686    return m_piData1[m_iHead];
00687 }
00688 
00689 void CRcvLossList::getLossArray(int32_t* array, int& len, const int& limit, const int& threshold)
00690 {
00691    len = 0;
00692 
00693    // do not feedback NAK unless no retransmission is received within a certain interval
00694    if (int(CTimer::getTime() - m_TimeStamp) < threshold)
00695       return;
00696 
00697    int i = m_iHead;
00698 
00699    while ((len < limit - 1) && (-1 != i))
00700    {
00701       array[len] = m_piData1[i];
00702       if (-1 != m_piData2[i])
00703       {
00704          // there are more than 1 loss in the sequence
00705          array[len] |= 0x80000000;
00706          ++ len;
00707          array[len] = m_piData2[i];
00708       }
00709 
00710       ++ len;
00711 
00712       i = m_piNext[i];
00713    }
00714 
00715    m_TimeStamp = CTimer::getTime();
00716 }
